fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the latest release, JIRA v1000.456.2, the Kanban Backlog is showing the subtasks in Backlog. 
Customers that were previously using Backlog on Scrum Board, expect that subtasks should not be shown. 
Customer says that having subtasks in Backlog makes planing difficult. 

*  !Subtasks in Backlog.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the subtasks form Kanban Backlog

h3. Workaround
Use a filter for the board that doesn't show sub-tasks
{code}
project = "Project Name" and issuetype != Sub-task ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

Note: Because of the filter used, the subtasks are not shown in the Kanban Board neither but there is a note in the Issue Detail View. 
* !Subtask in Issue Detail View.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Kanban Board should not show sub-tasks in Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you select a story/issue in the Active sprints view of a scrum board, then you type {{e}} on the keyboard to show the edit issue dialog, then you select _Cancel_ without changing anything, it will show up an incorrect warning message.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.2.3
* Latest Google Chrome browser (version 54.0.2840.59)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum board with sample data
# Go to Active sprints view
# Select any of the issue/story
# Type {{e}} on the keyboard
# The edit issue dialog will show up
# Click on _Cancel_ without changing/modifying anything

h3. Expected Results
The edit issue dialog would just disappear as there is no changes been performed.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the following warning message:
{code}
You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost.
{code}
!warning_message.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Open the issue/story in a new browser tab instead using the shortcut key
fields.summary: incorrect message shown when cancel the edit issue dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using JIRA 6.4.7 and JIRA Agile 6.7.12, upgrading the HipCHat for JIRA add-on to 7.8.26 will cause the following message to appear on the JIRA Agile board:
{quote}An error occurred
 Hide…

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
 Details

Exception: Error: undefined missing wrm/context-path
 Resource: [http://localhost:8080/s/a3e7242b45cffdaa5dff1f19b2d84ea9-CDN/en_US-b18r25/64022/4/2/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US]
 Line: 6
 Column: 3667

Environment
 Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:49.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/49.0
 Stack trace

main@[http://localhost:8080/s/a3e7242b45cffdaa5dff1f19b2d84ea9-CDN/en_US-b18r25/64022/4/2/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:6:3667]
 req/<@[http://localhost:8080/s/a3e7242b45cffdaa5dff1f19b2d84ea9-CDN/en_US-b18r25/64022/4/2/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:6:4435]
{quote}
h3. Environment

Fresh JIRA instance running PSQL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 6.4.7
 # Install JIRA Agile 6.7.12
 # Update the HipChat for JIRA Add-on to the latest version
 # Navigate to a JIRA Agile board

h3. Expected Results

No error message will be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

!error.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Customer mentioned the error shows on Active Sprint, for me the error showed when trying to copy the board, 3 separate instances have now confirmed this issue occurs with the latest version of the add-on.
h3. Workaround

Downgrade the add-on to version 7.8.24 via the following steps:
 # Navigate to *Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons*. 
 # Locate *HipChat for JIRA* on the list of installed addons
 # Click on the add-on to open its details view.
 # Click the *Uninstall* button.
 # Confirm the action by clicking *Continue*.
 # Download [JIRA Integration for HipChat version 7.8.24|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.hipchat.hipchat-for-jira-plugin/version/1060210191] from marketplace
 # Click the *upload add-on* button and upload the plugin JAR retrieved in step 6.
# Hipchat for JIRA plugin should now be successfully downgraded to 7.8.24
fields.summary: HipChat for JIRA add-on 7.8.26 generates error on JIRA Agile Board: Exception: Error: undefined missing wrm/context-path

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When navigating between reports on an agile board, the last viewed report is remembered and displayed when the user navigates back to the reports page for the board again.  However if the last viewed option was the “All Reports” screen, when returning back it goes back to the last viewed report instead, unless no reports have been viewed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board for a project - A
 # Create another board for the same project - B
 # View the reports from the menu
 # Select the Burndown Report
 # Navigate to Board A
 # View the Control Chart
 # Navigate back to Board B
 # Burndown report is displayed (/)
 # Change the report to “All reports”
 # Navigate to Board B
 # Control chart is displayed (/)
 # Navigate to Board A
 # Burndown Report is displayed (x)

h3.  Expected Results
Instead of the Burndown report being displayed, the “All Reports” page should be remembered and displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The All Reports page is not remembered, so it leads to a confusing navigation experience.
  
h3. Workaround
Select all reports from the list
fields.summary: View ‘All Reports’ selection is not remembered after moving to another board

fields.description: There are other tickets asking for a favorites feature for boards, but this will not solve our problem.  Our instance is 2000 users and 300 projects and boards a VERY popular for good reason.  However this success has cone with a downside.  We have so many boards created over time that the list takes a very long time to load.  Users forget to deleted boards they no longer use and being able to manage this by reporting on boards that have not been used in  6-12 months is a basic management need for this.  Viewing if a project has has activity is NOT sufficient for this need as a particular board may no longer be used even if the project is still active.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I need to see the date an Agile board was last accessed to notify users to delete unused boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

From investigating PS-7804 JIRA hits OOME because user create board with empty filter that load all issues in the instance and dump into the memory. JIRA eventually hit OOME when user accesses this board repeatedly.
h3. Environment
 * Large instance with > 1M issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # generate 1M issues
 # create Agile board with empty board filter
 # load this board repeatedly

h3. Expected Results
 # there should be a limit of issues can be loaded in a single board
 # there should be a validation check for creating board with empty filter 

h3. Actual Results
 * JIRA hits OOME

h3. Note
* For this fix to work you need to set *"Disable empty JQL queries set"* to +ON+.
* Please note that fix in JRASERVER-65602 would partially fix the current problem. This is due to the fact that when Agile executes the board's JQL it adds additional parameters to query so, JQL becomes "not empty" (see JRASERVER-67409).

h3. Workaround
* Use the following SQL to list boards with empty filter
{code:sql}
 SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" WHERE "SAVED_FILTER_ID" IN (SELECT id FROM searchrequest WHERE reqcontent = '');
{code}
* To avoid loading the board directly, modify the ID in the request call below to bring you to its configuration page where you can modify the JQL in use:
https://yourdomain.com/secure/RapidView.jspa?rapidView=5791&tab=filter|
fields.summary: Agile board with empty filter can trigger OOME

fields.description:
If a user sets up JIRA in German, the "New Feature" issue type has the name "Neue Funktion". Unfortunately, Bitbucket Server's issue-type-to-branch-model matching is based on the issue type name. As a result, the branch model doesn't work.

Until we implement BSERV-4139, ensure that we support the default issue types for our 4 supported languages (English, German, French and Japanese). 

Created based on [Andreas's comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-4139?focusedCommentId=930840&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-930840] on a related issue.
fields.summary: Branch model should handle JIRA running in other languages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When there is a special character in project name (For example {{#}}) JIRA fails to generate reports.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum software development project with the name {{Test C#}}.
# Try to create a "Created vs. Resolved Issues Report" in the newly created project.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA displays the configuration page for the report.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in UI:
 !2016-10-12_report_config.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The error is due to URL encoding.
JIRA is using the following URL to request the configuration page without encoding the special character in the URL :
{{http://<JIRA base URL>/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10100&projectOrFilterId=project-10100&projectOrFilterName=Test%20C#&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.jira-core-reports-plugin:createdvsresolved-report}}

h3.Workaround
Manually encoding the project name in URL by changing {{#}} to {{%23}}
fields.summary: Special character in project name causes "Configure Report - Error"

fields.description:
eh3. Summary

When accessing the *Control Chart* in a JIRA Software Project while using IE11, and being on JIRA Software 7.2.x+, an error is thrown in the UI:

 !Control_Chart_Error.png|thumbnail! 

When analyzing the error in IE11's Developer Console, the following can be seen:

 !Control_Chart_Console.png|thumbnail! 

It's uncertain at this time whether there are detrimental effects to the data in the Control Chart itself when this happens.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core - 7.2.1
* JIRA Software - 7.2.1
* Windows 8.1 Pro
* Internet Explorer 11.0.9600.18427

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh, new instance of JIRA Software 7.2.x on Windows 8.1 or like environment
# Enable the Rich Text Editor in *Administration >> System >> Rich text editor*
# Create a brand new Software Project
# Navigate to the Project/Board's *Reports >> Control Chart*

h3. Expected Results

The Control Chart screen should load normally with no error messages.

h3. Actual Results

The Control Chart screen will throw the errors in the screenshots above. Causes IE to be unresponsive, user must close IE and reopen.
 
h3. Notes
This does not appear to reproduce in Firefox or Chrome.

h3.Workaround
Disable the Rich Text Editor in your environment at *Administration >> System >> Rich text editor*
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor in JIRA 7.2.x causes error in JIRA Software Control Chart using Internet Explorer 11

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Presently, when a user clones an Epic, the Epic Name field is not presented in the clone screen.  The value is copied as is from the source Epic to the target Epic.  If the user who created the cloned Epic does not immediately edit the Epic Name field after the clone is created, this can lead to unintended duplication of Epic Names. 

To help prevent the confusion that can result from this duplication of Epic Names, please add the Epic Name field to the clone screen when an issue in the Epic Issue Type is cloned.  This will allow users to edit the field before the clone is completed in the same manner that the Summary field is presented for editing in the clone process.
fields.summary: Allow Epic Name field to be edited when an Epic is cloned

fields.description:
h3. Scenario

User is performing multiple project imports of projects that belonged to the same board / shared of the same sprint. For each import performed, JIRA creates a different sprint with the exact same name.

h3. Expected Behaviour

JIRA would notice that the Sprint already exists throughout the import and not create a new one.

h3. Workaround
Bulk edit the issue in the duplicated sprint to the original sprint by referring to the Sprint ID and not name. This will however, impact the reporting for the sprint if its related to an active sprint
fields.summary: Project Import imports the same sprint multiple times

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For Agile planning, the existing "Backlog" view in a JIRA Scrum board is extremely limited and almost useless for real planning (though it is just barely better than nothing). 

We need a hierarchical view of Epics and Stories in one page so that we can 
* manage both epics and stories
* be able to actually read the Epics (current left hand column is way to small and not even an expandable panel), 
* easily see the hierarchy, 
* easily be able to select fields to show on that list, 
* have editable inline fields on the view, 
* drag and drop prioritization
* ability to move stories between epics, 
* etc. (hint: see VersionOne, Rally, TFS, Thoughtworks, etc, etc, etc, etc).

There is a reference to hierarchy in the community questions but there is no response from Atlassian. Its very old and this is clearly a huge miss in my opinion.
[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/933/hierarchical-view-of-epics-and-user-stories]
fields.summary: Hierarchy view for Epics and User Stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

When completing a sprint, it's values are updated on the Velocity Chart report. If the board's filter is changed to something that does not include any of the tickets of said report result, they are completely removed from the report. See screen shots for example.

!original-report.png|thumbnail!

!report-changed-after-filter-query.png|thumbnail!

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a board
* Create a few tickets with Estimation
* Put those tickets on the sprint and start it
* Complete a few issues and complete the sprint
* Check the Velocity Chart report. It contains the information regarding the Commitment and Completed values for the Sprint closed
* Change the board filter to filter out some of the issues included on the sprint (I created them with different issue types in order to make the filtering easier)
* Check back the Velocity Chart report and noticed that the initial report data changed.

h3. Expected Behaviour

Reports data consistency is kept and the reports result do not change even after changing the filter board.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart data changes with the board filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-15001].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Adding the *Sprint Health Gadget* or *Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget* will not work correctly when selecting the Auto sprint option when the user's preferred language is not English.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud v1000.383.2 (I don't have a permission to add new *Affects Version/s* that's why I wrote here.)
* JIRA Server 7.2.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board
# Create a sprint
# Add an issue to the backlog
# Start the sprint
# Change user language to Japanese (Confirmed this happens in Spanish, Korean, and Chinese as well, but possibly all other languages)
# Add *Sprint Health Gadget ("スプリントヘルスガジェット" in Japanese)* or *Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget ("スプリントガジェット内の残り日数" in Japanese)* to a dashboard
# Set sprint as *Next Sprint Due (auto)* ("次のスプリント期限（自動）" in Japanese) in the configuration
# Press "Save" button

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should display the sprint health info correctly.
 !sprint-health-gadget-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
An error "リクエストしたボードを表示できません。ボードが存在しないかまたは表示する権限がありません。" was shown. ("The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it." in English.)
 !sprint-health-gadget-1.png|thumbnail! 

Just changing the user language back to English didn't solve the problem.
 
h3. Notes
* This problem never occurred on *JIRA 6.4.x*
* This problem never occurred on *Sprint Burndown Gadget*
* Investigation
When pressing the "Save" button, I can find the following accesses in developer tool.
When it comes to the one in Japanese setting, *sprintId* seems to be corrupted.
** Pressing the "Save" button in Japanese setting
**- https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/gadgets/sprints/health?rapidViewId=7&sprintId=%26%2333258%3B%26%2321205%3B&_=1475197516579
** Pressing the "Save" button in English setting
**- https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/gadgets/sprints/health?rapidViewId=7&sprintId=15&_=1475197064445

h3.Workaround
# Change the user language back to English
# Edit the gadget on the dashboard and save it. (This should immediately show the data once more on the gadget)
# Change the user language back to their preferred language once again
fields.summary: Adding Sprint Health Gadget / Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget does not work when user language setting is not English

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in the [JIRA Software Labs Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/JIRA+Software+Labs#JIRASoftwareLabs-kanbanbacklogKanbanBacklog], there is not much information on how the new Kanban Board works. 

Compared to Scrum Boards, where there is only one status mapped in the Backlog, in the Kanban Board there are two statuses. 

This is because the status from the next column is also added to the Backlog in order to easily move issues to Plan, similarly as adding issues to Sprint in Scrum Boards. This however can be confusing, since there is only one status mapped to this column.

h3. Suggested Solution

Edit the documentation with more detailed information about the Kanban Boards.

*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-14984].
{panel}
h3. Summary
h3. Scenario A

Issues which Sprint has been set at creation issue screen will not appear in burndown chart if the sprint is removed from this issue.
 *Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a JIRA Software Project
 # Create a Sprint - You can start the Sprint or not.
 # Create an issue and set the Sprint in the issue creation screen
 ** Start the Sprint if you have not started.
 # Remove the issue from the Sprint.

h3. Scenario B

The is also applicable for issues in the backlog that were previously associated with an active sprint and moved back to the backlog when the sprint is completed. 
 *Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create an issue
 # Move the issue to the active sprint
 # Complete the sprint and choose to move the issue to the backlog
 # Create a new Sprint
 # Move the issue to the active sprint (Start the Sprint if its not started)
 # Move the issue back to the backlog
 # The issue will disappear from the burndown chart although it was originally created in the backlog without specifying a sprint

h3. Expected Results

The burndown chart would show the issue as "Scope change issue removed"
h3. Actual Results

The burndown chart does not show the issue on it and make it seems like the issue never existed.
h3. Workaround

-The only known workaround for now is to put the issue back in the Sprint after removal and then remove again- 
 (!) No known workaround at this time, the previously noted workaround effects the output of the velocity chart
h3. Note

Affected deleted issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-14982].
  {panel}

 

If you create a board based on a jql query the issues that are displayed come from many projects. The board configuration then mentions "The projects in this board cannot be listed because of the complexity of the board filter"

 
In such a configuration, the sidebar only mentions Kanban board/Reports/Invite your team but not any of the other links that you usually have on a board.
 
If the query returns only one (or a few) projects, bug JSW-13650 is applicable; but when the query is returning many jira-projects then JIRA cannot automatically deduce what needs to be shown. In such a situation, the Board configuration must contain options so that the board designer can specify what needs to be shown.
 
At the minimum the shortcut list must be configurable. Best also if the board dropdown list can be reused to link to other boards.
 
 
 
Example: specialisation across development teams.
Across the JIRA projects a specific subtask can be used (eg "infrastructure subtask"); or issues can be labled with "performance" .
Developers with that specific skillset need to (also) work across the teams. Hence they want a board showing all issues that eg require such a specialist to work on.
 
For such a board the releases link probably makes no sense as it would end up showing the releases of the entire company. But the board can contain shortcuts to sites that are frequently used by performance devs.
 
Example 2: Make a board to have an overview for a business program with all showstoppers / with all ongoing stories.
JQL: epic_link= "my epic" and type=bug and priority=Blocker
JQL: epic_link = "my epic" and sprint in opensprints()
 
While the issues may be scattered across the enterprise, the 80/20 rule dictates that most are inside a few JIRA projects. So it makes sense that next to the icon/name of this blocker-board there are links to the core-related JIRA boards.
fields.summary: Board using jql query across projects also need to have shortcuts and board links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Sprints are reordered in a SCRUM Backlog prior to being started, they are assigned a 'SEQUENCE ID' that takes presedence over the 'SPRINT ID' when ordered running sprints. This causes a large amount of confusion to Users as well as Project Administrators as the SCRUM UI does not offer any indication as to why the ordering is not appearing as one would assume it should.
h3. Environment

Cloud - 1000.350.1
 Server - Current
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new SCRUM Software Development Project
 or
 # Open an existing SCRUM Software Development Project
 # Create several sprints (you do not need to add issues to the Sprints)
 # Start at least one Sprint
 # Reorder several of the remaining Sprints within the backlog
 # Start the remaining Sprints

h3. Expected Results

The Sprints should follow the order in which they were started
h3. Actual Results

The Sprints follow the order in which their SPRINT IDs and if populated, their SEQUENCE IDs follow

Example:
{noformat}
jira=> select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "NAME" like '%TSSI%';
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE | END_DATE | ID |     NAME      | RAPID_VIEW_ID | SEQUENCE | STARTED | START_DATE | GOAL
--------+---------------+----------+----+---------------+---------------+----------+---------+------------+------
 f      |               |          | 33 |    Sprint 1   |            30 |          | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 34 |    Sprint 2   |            30 |          | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 35 |    Sprint 3   |            30 |          | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 36 |    Sprint 4   |            30 |          | f       |            |
(4 rows)




{noformat}
The above table shows the Sprints prior to being started and reordered in the Backlog. Notice there is no SEQUENCE ID populated for any of the Sprints.
{noformat}
jira=> select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "NAME" like '%TSSI%';
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE | END_DATE | ID |     NAME      | RAPID_VIEW_ID | SEQUENCE | STARTED | START_DATE | GOAL
--------+---------------+----------+----+---------------+---------------+----------+---------+------------+------
 f      |               |          | 36 |    Sprint 4   |           30  |       35 | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 34 |    Sprint 2   |           30  |       36 | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 33 |    Sprint 1   |           30  |       34 | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 35 |    Sprint 3   |           30  |       33 | f       |            |
(4 rows)




{noformat}
The above table shows the Sprints after being reordered. You will notice that the Sprints all have SEQUENCE IDs populated now which fall in line with their updated position in the overall order of Sprints. After starting all of these Sprints the SCRUM UI would render them in this order:
{noformat}
Sprint 3
Sprint 1
Sprint 4
Sprint 2




{noformat}
h3. Feature Request

It would be extremely helpful if it was possible to do one or all of the following within the SCRUM UI Backlog:
 - Reorder Sprints once they have been started
 - The ability to change the SEQUENCE ID of each Sprint
 - The ability to see the SEQUENCE ID in relation to the SPRINT ID
 - JIRA ordered solely based on the SEQUENCE ID and did not take the SPRINT ID into consideration in this case
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, I would like more robust options for Sprints prior to and after starting each Sprint within a SCRUM board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attach files to an issue in the Issue Detail View on a Board, file is attached multiple times under some circumstances.
h3. Environment

Tested with Chrome Version 53.0.2785.116 (64-bit) on OS X, Firefox 48.0.1 on OS X, as well as reported as occurring with Chrome 53.0.2785.113 on OS X.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.2.0 or 7.2.1
 # Create sample Scrum or Kanban Project
 # Navigate to Board -> Active Sprints or Board -> Kanban Board depending on type
 # Click on one of the Issues there

h4. Option 1 - Attach using "Attach Files" and Browse for file
 # Click "..." -> Attach Files
 # Attach a file
 # remove the file you just attached
 # "..." -> Attach files again, Without refreshing the page

h4. Option 2 - Drag and Drop

Drag and drop a file to attach it.
h3. Expected Results

Attachment is attached once.
h3. Actual Results

Attachment is attached twice (or more).
h3. Notes

Reloading page between delete and re-attaching appears to avoid this.

Problem also appears to occur when pasting screenshot from clipboard in the "Create Issue" screen from clicking "Create" button when performed from the Board page.
h2. Workaround
 - For users of JIRA 7.2.x
 Upgrade [JIRA Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-dnd-attachment-plugin/server/overview] to [4.3.11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-dnd-attachment-plugin/version/176] using Atlassian Marketplace

 - For users of JIRA 7.3.x
 Download the attached file: [^jira-dnd-attachment-plugin-4.4.11.jar] , go to Administration -> Add-ons -> Manage add-ons, use the option "Upload add-on" and select the downloaded file. This is going to install a patched version of JIRA Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin on your JIRA 7.3.x instance
fields.summary: Attachments double-uploading in Issue Detail View from Boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When releasing a version on JIRA it's no longer possible to select plans from different Bamboo Servers if there are more than one connected to JIRA.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have more than one Bamboo linked with JIRA
 # Go to a JIRA project and try to release a version selecting the option to "_Build and release_"
 # Select the "_with new build_" option

h3. Expected Results

You can select plans from all different Bamboo Servers linked to JIRA
h3. Actual Results

You can only select from one of them (usually the primary one)
h3. Workaround
h4. #1 - Manually release the build directly on Bamboo
h4. #2 - Set the Bamboo Link for each project individually

Configure the Bamboo link on a per-Project basis in Jira, this way you get the contents of your defined Bamboo Application link, instead of the globally defined one.

In Jira,
 * Go to Settings -> Application Links
 * Click on "*Bamboo Configuration*" (it's right below Application Links and DVCS accounts)
 * You will see the list of linked Bamboo instances, _edit the one that is not your default_, and write the *_Jira Project Key_* to it. If you have more than one project to be included, separate each key with a space character.
 * Click "*Update*"

After you have set a custom Bamboo application link for your Project, all release requests will use that Bamboo link. You will not see any projects or plans from other Bamboo servers.

fields.description:
1. *Development Panel:*
In this documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Code+Development+Tools 
it is stated that you will need to *disable user impersonation* for the Development Panel to work:
{quote}
You may need to reconfigure the application link(s) between JIRA and the other applications. To enable the integration features, each application link must use 2-legged OAuth (without user impersonation) for both incoming and outgoing authentication. 
{quote}
This is not accurate because I was able to get it working, with or without User Impersonation. 

============================

2. *User Authentication for OAuth* 
According to the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Configuring+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link 
{quote}
Impersonating authentication types make requests on behalf of the user who is currently logged in. People will see only the information that they have permission to see. This includes OAuth and Trusted Applications authentication.
{quote}
Take the following example: (I tested this with JIRA 6.2.6 and Confluence 5.4.4. Impersonation is *enabled* in Confluence's incoming OAuth authentication)
# Lets say I am trying to link a Confluence page in a JIRA issue via the Link Confluence page option.
# I have User_A in JIRA and User_B in Confluence.
# As User_A, I click on the "authenticate" button in JIRA to authenticate with Confluence.
# I log in as User_B. 
# Token is approved and I can now link the page without problems.

In this case, how does enabling Impersonation make any difference ? The docs say that we should be authenticating *as User_A*, because *that is the user that I am currently logged in as in JIRA*. User_A has no token in confluence because the token was approved for User_B anyway. 

As a test, I disabled user impersonation again, and the behavior is *exactly* the same as having it enabled. I still can approve tokens for other users etc.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior of enabling or disabling "Allow User Impersonation"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a dev team member I want to see how many builds are associated with a JIRA issue.

h3. Suggested Solution

Show the total number of all builds that have a commit referencing the JIRA issue.

Alternatively, add text to the link for clarity: "1 build of the latest commit"

Alternatively, add a "?" icon which explains the meaning on hover or click.

h3. Detailed Explanation

Tested with JIRA 6.3.15, Stash 3.10.2 and Bamboo 5.9.3

To display builds JIRA uses the same definition that Stash does to display builds associated with a pull request.  From the Stash documentation, [Checks for merging pull requests|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Checks+for+merging+pull+requests]:
{quote}
Select this option to stop pull requests from being merged if they have any unsuccessful builds. _For a pull request, this checks builds that run against the latest commit on the source branch._ (emphasis added)
{quote}

The number of builds shown in JIRA is builds of the last commit of that branch.  This makes sense in a pull request context because each commit is a different state of the code and only the final state of the code will be merged.  When a build is triggered these variant builds can be run in parallel, resulting in multiple successful builds of the same version of the code.

In the JIRA issue context the total number of builds referencing the JIRA issue would be more useful.  This gives a relative idea of how much activity has occurred for the issue.

Cheers,
Morgan Knicely
Atlassian Premier Support - Austin, TX
fields.summary: JIRA should show the total builds of a branch rather than total builds of the latest commit

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-14942].
  {panel}

Hi,

Recently, during a release procedure, I came across behaviour that seems erroneous. Here's what I did, as far as I can remember:

1. I had 3 issues with 3 BitBucket pull requests associated with them, visible through the Development panel on the Issue page.
2. I accepted the pull requests into the {{develop}} branch. The Version page showed no warnings, as no issue was under review any longer.
3. I created another pull request to merge {{develop}} into {{master}}. BitBucket detected the issues as being associated with the pull request.
4. The Version page showed 3 warnings, saying that there are unmerged pull requests.

At this point, hovering over "Under Review" for each issue on the Version page showed a popup stating that there is 1 pull request. Clicking "Under Review" reveals 2 pull requests, one of which is the original pull request for the issue, and the other one is the one from {{develop}} into {{master}}. On the Issue page for any of the 3 issues, similar behaviour could be observed: the "Development" panel shows 1 pull request with status "Open". Clicking it reveals 2 pull requests, one of which is the {{develop -> master}} pull request with status "Open" and the other one is the original issue pull request with status "Merged".
fields.summary: Pull requests wrongly associated with issues

fields.description:
*_As a_* person preparing release on a multi-repository project looking at a ticket's Pull Request list
 *_I want_* be able to easily tell PRs that implement the fix (branch name or PR title contains the ticket) from other pull requests that merely mention the ticket
 *_So that_* I don't accidentally merge a PR that implements a different ticket

*_As a_* developer collaborating on code in a multi-repository project
 *_I want_* be able to mention any ticket in my [PR description, commit message, comment] without worrying about causing mistakes during release
 *_So that_* I can share all the important information about tickets related to my change

In our team the project spans a great many repositories. Because of that there is almost always 4~5 Pull Requests that a ticket introduces. So, a ticket's PR dialog is used as the authoritative information to tell which pull requests should be merged to release a the ticket's feature. Moreover, merges are done by the QA team which is not involved in details of the development.

We could easily prevent a mistake of merging a wrong PR if the ones that are associated based on title texts (PR title/source branch) were made much more prominent than those associated on mentions in 'prose texts' (PR description, commit message, code review discussions, if ever implemented).

Some implementation options:
* Have a separate main list for when ticket occurs in branch name or PR title, and a separate 'Mentioned in' list with all the rest
   (This would be the preferred solution for teams like ours, because of the importance we attach to the main group.)
* Add pictogram flags next to a PR that show the types of associations which were found (ideally pictograms for the branch name & PR title should be much more prominent than the others)
fields.summary: Ticket's pull requests list - Show type of association (PR title/branch/commit msg)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status – 03 January 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for providing your thoughts and votes on this suggestion. We know it's been a while since this suggestion was raised and we're sorry to have kept you so long without a clear answer.

Your feedback has really helped us better understand the varied challenges you face with inability to see branch information in the list of commits in the development panel. Despite our lack of communication, this problem is actually one of those areas we plan to improve in Jira. Right now we've decided to prioritise it on our roadmap.

Thank you again for all your feedback on this suggestion and we look forward to providing you with more updates as we work on improving user experience of the Development panel.

Best,
 Anton Genkin | Product Manager - Integrations
{panel}
This was requested to be entered as an improvement per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Viewing+the+Code+Development+Information+for+an+Issue?focusedCommentId=457704004#comment-457704004]

After conversion to the new Development panel with upgrade to Jira 6.2, the Commits tab no longer shows (since we are connected to GitHub, which is expected). The old Commits tab, however, listed the branch name in the commit detail view. The new Development tab does not list the branch name along with the commit in the commits detail overlay. This was extremely valuable information, since not all of our branches follow the "feature branch" format (for example our "prerelease" and "bugpatch" branches). For those branches that are not tagged with the issue number, we now can no longer tell which branch the commits have been pushed to, since that information does not show up anywhere in the Development panel. As a side note, our QA department used the Commits tab in this manner: Click on it in one issue, go through the list of open stories for testing to see which branches things were on. Because the "last selected" tab was automatically selected when opening another issue, that allowed QA to flip through the issues with minimal interaction. That is now also not possible with the Development panel, as you must click on the commits link in every issue in order to view the information.
 A configurable flag to *also* show the Commits tab would be an acceptable improvement, but showing the branch identifier in the Commits detail list is really a better improvement (although more clicks, we have other ways to flip through the list)

*JIRA Version v 6.1.7*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

*JIRA Version v 7.1.2*
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch information missing from the list of commits in the Development panel

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a filter id=xxxxx
# In issue navigator, select List View instead of Details View
# Go to an issue that's not in the filter, e.g., /browse/DEV-123?filter=xxxxx
# The Development panel reports an error
#* The ajax call is returning 400 because a null issueId is passed in

SearchPageModule.getEffectiveIssue() returns an empty issue object when the current issue is not in the requested filter.

!null-issue-not-in-filter.png!

*Workaround*: enable Details view (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Issue+Navigator)
